summary: An Inn Converted to a home, for immersion players
descriptionHtml:
I released a mod a while back called Philly\'s bar but I was never quite happy with it.

Located between the North watch tower and Fort Greymor, you can\'t miss it.
The key is in a lock box under the steps on the right hand side.


This is a redone version that feels a lot more comfortable.  I was able to redo the lights so it has shadow casters on all but 2 lights without it glitching out, yay!, I\'d avoid torches and such though.

I use Frostfall, Skyrealism - Feast and Famine, and Crafting 300 - Armory of Tamriel  so the home is designed with those mods in mind.  Particularly the kitchen...Lots of storage.  Also the home has a fully equipped smithy including a custom smelter that will not take up the entire room plus it looks good and seems to make sense from a believability standpoint and a 3X16 bookshelf for those of us that collect those smithing design books.

There is room for loads of books,  once I realized that I could duplicate a bookshelf setup and it would still work,  I kind of went a little nuts with the book shelves.

Be warned,  The house will be infested with bandits when you get there.  not too bad, but a challenge if you\'re using a brand new char.

Also,  the previous owner had his fingers in a lot of pockets so you will find some decent loot.  but not too nice.

Mostly, this is just a more rational version of the old Philly\'s bar.

if you are one the literally ten\'s of people who downloaded the first one,  thank you :)
if you are one the literally ten\'s of people who downloaded and use the first one,  thank you as well,  also you will need to move you stuff out to update :) sorry.   




Recommended  - NOT required
Frostfall
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/11163

Skyrealism - Feast and Famine
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/22327/

Crafting 300 - Armoury of Tamriel 
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/2933
author: armspree
